title: Len Saldua
author: Len Saldua
created_time: January 09, 2023, 11:05:23 AMLast edit: January 09, 2023, 02:59:47 PM by mprep
content: WHAT !?!?I haven't checked my MetaMask account for about a month, and now a go back and try to check it and it's not there !!I went to the MetaMask website it gives me two options:create new account, Import passphrase ( or something like that ) I did not want to create a new account, so I enteredmy 12 word seedphrase there and then it asks me to create a new password. WHy would I want to create a newpassword when the old one should still work, however there was no option to enter the old password so I created a new one ( same as the old one ) . Once I entered those details now it takes me to a brand NEW ACCOUNT with nothing on it !! ZERO assets !!WTF ?!? This is not what I want ! Where is my old account !? I had 7K worth of assets there and now ? where is it ?What's the point of a seedphrase if you can't retrieve your old account !! I need a private key ? I don't think I have that ?I don't have a JSON file either ? WTF ?!  I thought 12 word seedphrase and password was enough ? Did I lose access to all my assets now ?[moderator's note: consecutive posts merged]

comments.author: Coyster
comments.body: Quote from: Len Saldua on January 09, 2023, 11:05:23 AMWhat's the point of a seedphrase if you can't retrieve your old account !! The point of a seed phrase is to import the funds in the wallet at anytime to any compatible wallet; and that means anybody (not just the owner of the funds) who gets hold of the seed phrase can import the funds in the wallet, maybe someone managed to get hold of your seed phrase and has imported it and sent it to a new wallet with a different seed phrase/private key.How well/safe did you keep your seed phrase, was it exposed?

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: It looks like you held many accounts under one secret recovery phrase[1], hence you probably just need to re-add the missing accounts and import the contract addresses of the tokens or assets you owned. Try clicking the "Create Account" until you come across with the account that has your balance with the help of etherscan[2].[1] https://metamask.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360015489271-How-to-add-missing-accounts-after-restoring-with-Secret-Recovery-Phrase[2] https://etherscan.io/

comments.author: dimonstration
comments.body: Quote from: Len Saldua on January 09, 2023, 11:05:23 AMWHAT !?!?I haven't checked my MetaMask account for about a month, and now a go back and try to check it and it's not there !!I went to the MetaMask website it gives me two options:create new account, Import passphrase ( or something like that ) I did not want to create a new account, so I enteredmy 12 word seedphrase there and then it asks me to create a new password. WHy would I want to create a newpassword when the old one should still work, however there was no option to enter the old password so I created a new one ( same as the old one ) . Once I entered those details now it takes me to a brand NEW ACCOUNT with nothing on it !! ZERO assets !!WTF ?!? This is not what I want ! Where is my old account !? I had 7K worth of assets there and now ? where is it ?What's the point of a seedphrase if you can't retrieve your old account !! Did you add account to your metamask address and deposit your balance in there? It’s normal that you will create new password if you import again your seed phrase to metamask after your account logout. Probably you clear data of your browser which results to automatically logout of your metamask.Try to keep adding account on your metamask after you input your seed-phrase until you see the account that holds your balance. This happened to me before when I add new account on my metamask and deposit coins on the extra address.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: The reason why it asks you for a password form again is that in Metamask, the password is used to lock the application/extension itself. So each one you use Metamask on any device, the password will be unique. The only thing you should keep is a secret recovery phrase/seed phrase. You can learn more at https://metamask.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/4405451730331.Metamask has an extensive information page on its website, if you have any questions, try to utilize the search functionality first. It has a thorough explanation and will answer basic things on OP. In regard to your current problem, try Maus0728 suggestion and make sure you use the correct network/chain. If that still doesn't gives you any luck, are sure you are using the current intended seed phrase?

comments.author: Mpamaegbu
comments.body: Quote from: Len Saldua on January 09, 2023, 11:05:23 AMhowever there was no option to enter the old password so I created a new one ( same as the old one ) . Once I entered those details now it takes me to a brand NEW ACCOUNT with nothing on it !! ZERO assets !!Of course, it will show you zero assets because you just created a new wallet there. Look for the "had account" or so option and pick "import seedphrase" and you will be fine. Metamask is ok and I believe your funds are intact. The only thing that can make them gone is if you compromised your seedphrase. If that happens, you should be able to see where your funds moved to. Since you haven't seen that your funds moved it means it's still there.

comments.author: Outhue
comments.body: You have to create another password or use the old password if you are trying to import your recovery seed, this is normal for the metamask wallet and it doesn't mean that something is wrong. Not until you import your recovery seed and see that the wallet is empty that's when you can start raising alarms and if you created multiple addresses you need to keep clicking on create account to get access back to the addresses again.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: Len Saldua on January 09, 2023, 11:05:23 AMit asks me to create a new password. WHy would I want to create a newpassword when the old one should still work, however there was no option to enter the old password so I created a new one ( same as the old one )After you typing your seed, you must have a password to protect your wallet on the browser. The password can be a previous one or a new one but basically you should never reuse your old passwords.QuoteOnce I entered those details now it takes me to a brand NEW ACCOUNT with nothing on it !! ZERO assets !!WTF ?!? This is not what I want ! Where is my old account !? I had 7K worth of assets there and now ? where is it ?What's the point of a seedphrase if you can't retrieve your old account !! With same seed, you can create multiple accounts. It is similar to using Electrum wallet with same seed but you can have many receiving addresses.If you want to find your account that has fund inside, please try above guide.Why do I have the same seed phrase for all of my MetaMask addresses/accounts?QuoteCopy and paste these rules and place them within your computer or mobile device, and/or write these down and place them next to you.Rule #1: Never share your 12-word Secret Recovery Phrase (SRP) or private keysRule #2: Beware of impersonators! Make sure to verify it is an official account!Rule #3: Never DM with someone offering to help.Your secret seed phrase allows you to restore/import all of the addresses/accounts associated with your MetaMask wallet.You can import individual addresses/accounts to a different wallet by just exporting the private key. You can find instructions to do so hereHow to Export an account Private key

comments.author: Len Saldua
comments.body: Thanks people ! I managed to see my funds again, but it was not very intuitive.I had my MetaMask linked to the Trezor device, so luckily connecting my Trezor kinda fixed things.I say "kinda" because once I connected my Trezor, it only showed me my ETH balance, all the other Altcoins I hadin all the other Networks were missing. So it was up to me to remember exactly what coins I had and in what Networks.Fortunately I could do that but it was tedious as I had to re add them to MetaMask one by one, not at all intuitive.What caused this problem was Chrome accidentally clearing my history ( I must have clicked the wrong button or somethn )so MetaMask did not recognize I was a long time user and treated me as though I was using Meta Mask for the first time.I was disappointed it took me a long time to restore my old settings and looking to get rid of my Meta Mask as soon as possible.I still have no idea what this "private key" is about or the damn .JSON file , that sounds way too elaborate and overly complicated,I'm not really interested !  I already had a super complicated password, a 12 word seedphrase, and a Trezor hardware device setup, why ask for more ? To make things worse, MetaMask does not have customer support, when you click on their "contact support" theyforce you to go elsewhere and find the answer to your question there, and only come back when you exhausted all other options.So basically, " get lost, we're too busy for you, just find your answer in the nerds forum and come back next week ".Not impressed !

comments.author: pixie85
comments.body: Quote from: Len Saldua on January 09, 2023, 05:32:40 PMI still have no idea what this "private key" is about or the damn .JSON file , that sounds way too elaborate and overly complicated,I'm not really interested !  I already had a super complicated password, a 12 word seedphrase, and a Trezor hardware device setup, why ask for more ? It's either that or a centralized exchange wallet. They'll do everything for you, make the API as easy as possible and you won't get any annoying seeds or private keys because they'll keep all of that secret.The problem is, when they decide they don't want you to get your coins, you won't get them. When they decide they're going bankrupt, you'll go bankrupt too. You either learn or you pay someone else to do it for you and hope that person does it well. That's how it is in every aspect of life.I'm glad you got your coins back. Make a list of all the coins you're holding to make the process easier next time.Keep those seeds and passwords safe.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: Len Saldua on January 09, 2023, 05:32:40 PMI say "kinda" because once I connected my Trezor, it only showed me my ETH balance, all the other Altcoins I hadin all the other Networks were missing.No, those tokens are not missing anywhere. They are on their blockchains at a wallet address you store them.By default, smart contract wallets use Ethereum network that is a first smart-contract blockchain. If you want to use your wallet for other blockchains, you must add them to your wallets such as Binance Smart Chain BSC, Harmony, Avalanche.Add Binance Smart Chain to MetamaskAdd Harmony to MetamaskAdd Avalanche to MetamaskI really wonder how did you don't know these steps. You might not know how to recover your wallets, accounts but adding chains you must know. If you don't know, how did you buy those tokens in the past?QuoteSo it was up to me to remember exactly what coins I had and in what Networks.You can use block explorers to check or you can recall what networks you use in the past with that wallet, adding those chains and check your wallet balance.

WHy would I want to create a newpassword when the old one should still work, however there was no option to enter the old password so I created a new one ( same as the old one ) . Once I entered those details now it takes me to a brand NEW ACCOUNT with nothing on it !! ZERO assets !!WTF ?!? This is not what I want ! Where is my old account !? I don't think I have that ?I don't have a JSON file either ? WTF ?!  I thought 12 word seedphrase and password was enough ? Did I lose access to all my assets now ?[moderator's note: consecutive posts merged]Ofcourse you need to setup a password in chrome, everytime you import account in a metamask app in chrome it will ask you to set a password, its for your own security because some people, let others use their pc, if it has a password they can't send your coins to their wallet, regarding with your coin, metamask is default set to ethereum chain, are you sure you put it in that chain or, binance chain etc? also make sure that wallet is where you put the money or coin.

comments.author: libert19
comments.body: Quote from: Len Saldua on January 09, 2023, 05:32:40 PM So it was up to me to remember exactly what coins I had and in what Networks.Fortunately I could do that but it was tedious as I had to re add them to MetaMask one by one, not at all intuitive.Next time search up your address on https://etherscan.io/. It will show tokens you hold under 'token' section. QuoteI still have no idea what this "private key" is about or the damn .JSON file , that sounds way too elaborate and overly complicatedThose are alternative ways to restore your wallet, if you keep your seed phrase safe there is no need to bother with those.

comments.author: tvplus006
comments.body: Quote from: Len Saldua on January 09, 2023, 05:32:40 PM...I still have no idea what this "private key" is about or the damn .JSON file , that sounds way too elaborate and overly complicated,I'm not really interested ! ...All your problems that you have when using MetaMask are related to your ignorance and unwillingness to study the documentation, which is necessary for everyone to keep their coins safe. I don't want this to happen to you, but if you don't learn a lesson from what happened, then you will definitely lose all your funds that you keep in your wallet.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Quote from: Len Saldua on January 09, 2023, 05:32:40 PMI still have no idea what this "private key" is about or the damn .JSON file , that sounds way too elaborate and overly complicatedDon't mess with those things. If they end up in the wrong hands (and it's very easy for that to happen when malware is involved) you will be robbed.Metamask has a really bad limitation where you have to import a really long string that corresponds to your account in Metqmask, to import it on s different device.QuoteTo make things worse, MetaMask does not have customer support, when you click on their "contact support" theyforce you to go elsewhere and find the answer to your question there, and only come back when you exhausted all other options.So basically, " get lost, we're too busy for you, just find your answer in the nerds forum and come back next week ".It's a non-custodial open source (?) wallet, but I'm a bit shocked they don't have their own forum website.

comments.author: capedbaldy
comments.body: Quote from: Maus0728 on January 09, 2023, 11:39:19 AMIt looks like you held many accounts under one secret recovery phrase[1], hence you probably just need to re-add the missing accounts and import the contract addresses of the tokens or assets you owned. Try clicking the "Create Account" until you come across with the account that has your balance with the help of etherscan[2].[1] https://metamask.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360015489271-How-to-add-missing-accounts-after-restoring-with-Secret-Recovery-Phrase[2] https://etherscan.io/You are right, I have experience because I forgot to save the PK from several addresses in metamask, my metamask account has logged out and requires logging in using the seed phrase so my metamask account is empty without any previous address list, but after clicking create account and all the old addresses are still stored , I immediately save the PK for guarantees to be able to access that address at any time regardless of the seed phrase
